alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AND WESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Beechwood Trails, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Newark, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Johnstown, Hebron, Beechwood Trails, Granville South, Summit Station, Etna, New Albany, Jersey, Kirkersville, Alexandria and State Route 310 at State Route 161. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 117 and 125. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
